intro: Cymopterus montanus var. globosus, commonly known as the globular evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, which are often dispersed by wind.
